Dear Jason Lheureux:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. No
substantial violations were found.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Cathrine Raftery, Licensing Consultant

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
***This report contains sexually explicit information***
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2024SIC0001728
Special Investigation Intake Date: August 30, 2024
License #: CI410337023
Licensee Group Organization: Wedgwood Christian Services
Licensee Designee: David Gorman
Chief Administrator: Jason Lheureux
Agency Name: WEST CAMPUS
Agency Address: 3240 36TH ST
GRAND RAPIDS, MI 49512-8193
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 08/30/2025
Capacity: 18

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Health services; policies and procedures.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(a) Routine and emergency medical, and dental, and behavioral
health care.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth received vaccinations even though the youth's paperwork
declined them.
Investigation Original allegations noted concerns of Youth A being
physically and sexually assault by other youth at the facility.
There were also concerns noting Youth A would tell staff
about concerns and they would be ignored. When Youth A
and Mother were interviewed on August 30, 2024, they both
confirmed those concerns were addressed in the following
special investigations: 2024C0001120SI and 2024C0001125SI.
Interviews:
Mother was interviewed face to face at her home on August
30, 2024, by MDHHS Worker 2, this consultant was involved
with the interview via phone. Mother reported she never gave
the facility permission for Youth A to receive the HPV
immunizations. She reported Youth A received three HPV
immunizations while residing at the facility.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at her home on August
30, 2024, by MDHHS Worker 2, this consultant was involved
with the interview via phone. Youth A reported one of the
nurses at the facility gave him the three HPV immunizations. He
reported he got the vaccinations because he thought his mother
consented to them.
Nurse was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 19, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker 1.
Nurse reported when Youth A was admitted into the facility Mother
signed all medical consent forms allowing for Youth A's medical
needs to be met, including immunizations. When Client Right’s
2

Advisor completed an internal investigation in June for similar
allegations, Nurse updated their immunization authorization form
to be more specific about the types of immunizations. She
reported Mother signed the updated form once it was completed
and did not note any immunizations, she would not let Youth A
have.
Client Rights Advisor was interviewed face to face at the
facility on September 19, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS
Worker 1. Client Rights Advisor reported in May 2024, she
received a complaint about Youth A receiving immunizations she
did not approve. She reported she completed an internal
investigation and found Mother had signed all appropriate
documentation allowing Youth A to get immunizations. Client
Rights Advisor reported when she spoke with Mother on the
phone, Mother acknowledged on her daughter’s paperwork she
declined the HPV immunizations and did not do it on Youth A’s
paperwork.
Documentation Reviewed:
- Handling and Administration and Medication Procedure
dated July 5, 2024- This policy notes that admission staff
will obtain written consent by legal guardian for medical
treatment including immunizations.
- Residential Medical Care Procedures dated July 5,
2024- The role of the nursing department maintains
compliance of the youth’s medical needs, including record
keeping of immunizations.
- Client Rights Investigative Report dated June 6, 2024-
The facility completed an internal investigation due to
Mother filing a complaint with the facility on May 14, 2024,
that she did not consent to Youth A being vaccinated with
the HPV immunizations. Client Rights Advisor found Mother
did provide full consent for Youth A to receive all
vaccinations via Youth A’s medical consent documentation
and interviews. It was noted with in Mother’s interview on
May 17, 2024, she mistook writing “No HPV vaccination on
some of her daughter’s medical consent paperwork, not
Youth A’s”.
- Youth A’s File- Mother signed medical consent agreement
at the facility on April 25, 2023, which allowed for
immunizations to be given. Mother signed the updated
vaccination form on June 18, 2024, which had no
3

comments about which immunizations she would not allow
her child to have.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as the facility had consent to
provide immunizations to Youth A at the time of admissions.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff qualifications
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff showed youth porn on his personal cell phone.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face to face at her home on August
30, 2024, by MDHHS Worker 2, this consultant was involved
with the interview via phone. Youth A reported Staff 1 would
show him porn on his cell phone. He reported Staff 1 no longer
works at the facility, so he feels comfortable talking about these
concerns. Youth A reported Staff 1 showed Youth B a porn video
on his phone and Youth A asked Staff 1 to show him too. When
asked what porn is, Youth A reported that it is photos of naked
ladies. He reported that he was able to see porn “more than a few
time” from Staff 1’s phone. Youth A explained this would happen
when other staff were not around and it was either in the sensory
room, outside or in the car. Youth A explained that youth had to be
on Staff 1’s “very good side” to get to see the porn as he had to
“trust” them. He reported no other youth being involved besides
Youth B. Youth A reported he did not want Staff 1 to get in any
trouble and noted he was a really good staff.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at her home on
September 16, 2024, by MDHHS Worker 3, this consultant was
involved with the interview via phone. Youth B reported he got
along well with Staff 1 and he was a “cool” staff. He reported Staff
1 was newer but was only there for a couple of weeks. Youth B
reported that staff were always texting on their cell phones. He
stated that he was never allowed to use a staff’s phone. Youth B
denied ever seeing anything inappropriate on a staff member’s
phone and never heard other youth talking about seeing anything
inappropriate on staff phones. He reported he did spend time with
Staff 1 and Youth A. Youth B denied ever looking at Staff 1’s
phone or ever seeing Youth A looking at Staff 1’s phone.
4

Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 19, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker 1.
Supervisor reported Staff 1 only worked at the facility for a short
period and was let go due to speeding in the agency vehicle. She
reported there were no concerns reported about his interactions
with the youth. Supervisor reported she never had concerns with
Staff 1 being on his cell phone or allowing the youth to use his cell
phone. She reported Youth A was working in therapy on his
sexualized behaviors and noted concerns from school of Youth A
searching the school computer for pornography. Supervisor
reported Youth B was a youth who would say something if staff
were not following the rules at the facility, especially if they were
on their phone or if a youth told him about something
inappropriate happened. She reported Youth B never disclosed
any concerns about Staff 1.
Staff 1, who is no longer employed for the facility, was
attempted to be interviewed via phone on September 23,
2024. Staff 1’s phone was shut off.
MDHHS Worker 1 was interviewed via phone on September
23, 2023. MDHHS Worker 1 stated he spoke with Law
Enforcement who was able to get a hold of Staff 1 via phone. He
reported Staff 1 refused to do an in-person interview and would
speak with Law Enforcement on the phone. MDHHS Worker
reported Staff 1 denied ever giving Youth A or Youth B his cell
phone and denied ever showing them photos of naked ladies/
pornography. He reported Staff 1 told Law Enforcement that
Youth A had sexualized behaviors and has gotten in trouble for
trying to look up pornography.
Documentation Reviewed:
- Staff 1’s Human Resource File- Staff 1 started working at
the facility on 04/29/2024 and was terminated on
06/10/2024 because of speeding in the agency vehicle.
Staff 1 was in compliance with all required trainings and
completed maintaining professional boundaries training on
April 30, 2024.
- Professional Staff Relationships Policy dated July 3,
2024- Staff are to provide professional treatment services
for clients. The policy notes, “Treatment is at its most
professional level when it is conducted in a planned and
5

purposeful way that prioritizes client need and is
implemented with compassion and integrity.”
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as there is not enough
information to support a rule violation as Youth B and Staff 1
denied Staff 1 showing porn to youth on his cell phone.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
October 9, 2024
